item.title: Electronics
item.description: Electronics # This page walks you through obtaining and putting together all the electronics components required for building a 3dasd scanner. Ordering everything # You need to get the following: two PCBs (main and power supply) with a bunch of electronic components two sets of NEMA 17 stepper motors and A4988 drivers Garmin LIDAR-Lite v3 a Raspberry Pi Zero W an Arduino Nano a slip-ring a 12V 2A power supply wires for making the cables Getting the PCBs # You need to get two PCBs: the scanner and the scanner-power-supply.

item.title: Mechanics
item.description: Mechanics # This page walks you through obtaining all the mechanical parts required for building a 3dasd scanner. Most of the chassis can be 3D-printed, but there are a few metal pieces that hold everything together. The metal parts # You need a couple nuts and bolts and also some ball bearings.
